Full Width Banners

Full Width Banners are used in a couple of occassions. The first as a "Hero" Banner at the top of a main landing page. The second would be for a call to action marketing banner that can be placed anywhere on the page.

Code

<div class="banner banner__blue">
    <div class="container banner_content">
        <h1 class="banner_text">CPS Header Title</h1>
        <p class="lead">Short description or sentence.</p>
        <p>
          <button class="btn btn-default btn-lg">Apply</button>
        </p>
    </div>
</div>

Banners have the options of either having a blue banner__blue, green banner__green, purple banner__purple, orange, or gray with special classes.

CPS Header Title

Short description or sentence.

Code

<div class="banner banner__img" bg-img="images/Brooks-CPS.jpg">
  <div class="container banner_content">
      <h1 class="container banner_content">CPS Header Title</h1>
      <p class="lead">Short description or sentence.</p>
      <p>
        <button class="btn btn-default btn-lg">Apply</button>
      </p>
  </div>
</div>

Banners with a background image need to have the attribute bg-img in the parent element, with the image location.

CPS Header Title

Short description or sentence.

Typography

CPS uses two fonts when creating web sites and applications.

  1. Century Gothic. Used as titles for important sections.
  2. Arial. Used mostly for paragraph text after title headers.

Header elements are used specifically for titles of major sections to the web page. In order to keep the Accessible, the site must follow a header hierarchy of h1 being the most important to h4 being the least important. There should only be one h1 element per page.

H1 heading 41px

H2 heading 34px

H3 heading 28px

H4 heading 20px

Paragraph text 16px

Buttons

Buttons should be used whenever there is an important call to action.

Code

<a class="btn btn-lg btn-primary" href="http://cps.edu">Primary</a>
or
<button type="button" class="btn btn-lg btn-primary">Primary</button>
Size Code Color Example
Large btn-lg Blue btn-primary Large Primary
Default none Gray btn-default Default
Small btn-sm Green btn-success Small Success
Extra Small btn-xs Light Blue btn-info Extra Small Info

There are two other options for button that are rarely used. btn-warning and btn-danger.

Tables

For large amounts of data sometimes it is necessary to use tables as a way to display the information in a user friendly way. All table elements must have two classes table and table_responsive. table will give the table its default styling.

Responsive Table

The class table_responsive is what will make the table responsive and mobile friendly. It however needs to be accompanied with data-column attributes to the td elements inside of the tbody. The values for data-colum attribute should mirror what the table headers are.

Code

<table class="table table-striped table_responsive">
    <thead>
       <tr>
         <th>#</th>
         <th>First Name</th>
         ...
       </tr>
    </thead>
    <tbody>
      <tr> 
        <td data-column="Number">1</td> 
        <td data-column="First Name">Mark</td> 
        ... 
      </tr>
    </tbody>
</table>
# First Name Last Name Username
1 Mark Otto @mdo
2 Jacob Thornton @fat
3 Larry the Bird @twitter
